glsa.title: BusyBox: Denial of Service
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in BusyBox might allow remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service condition.

background.p: BusyBox is a set of tools for embedded systems and is a replacement for GNU Coreutils.

description.p: The recv_and_process_client_pkt function in networking/ntpd.c in BusyBox allows remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service (CPU and bandwidth consumption) via a forged NTP packet, which triggers a communication loop.

impact.p: A remote attacker might send a specially crafted package to a machine running BusyBox ntpd, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
